verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:1
verses.text: O Lord, Almighty God of our fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and of their righteous seed;

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:2
verses.text: who hast made heaven and earth, with all the ornament thereof;

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:3
verses.text: who hast bound the sea by the word of thy commandment; who hast shut up the deep, and sealed it by thy terrible and glorious name;

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:4
verses.text: whom all men fear, and tremble before thy power; for the majesty of thy glory cannot be borne, and thine angry threatening toward sinners is importable:

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:5
verses.text: but thy merciful promise is unmeasurable and unsearchable;

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:6
verses.text: for thou art the most high Lord, of great compassion, longsuffering, very merciful, and repentest of the evils of men. Thou, O Lord, according to thy great goodness hast promised repentance and forgiveness to them that have sinned against thee: and of thine infinite mercies hast appointed repentance unto sinners, that they may be saved.

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:7
verses.text: Thou therefore, O Lord, that art the God of the just, hast not appointed repentance to the just, as to Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, which have not sinned against thee; but thou hast appointed repentance unto me that am a sinner: cb

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:8
verses.text: for I have sinned above the number of the sands of the sea. My transgressions, O Lord, are multiplied: my transgressions are multiplied, and I am not worthy to behold and see the height of heaven for the multitude of mine iniquities.

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:9
verses.text: I am bowed down with many iron bands, that I cannot lift up mine head, neither have any release: for I have provoked thy wrath, and done evil before thee: I did not thy will, neither kept I thy commandments: I have set up abominations, and have multiplied offences.

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:10
verses.text: Now therefore I bow the knee of mine heart, beseeching thee of grace.

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:11
verses.text: I have sinned, O Lord, I have sinned, and I acknowledge mine iniquities:

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:12
verses.text: wherefore, I humbly beseech thee, forgive me, O Lord, forgive me, and destroy me not with mine iniquites. Be not angry with me for ever, by reserving evil for me; neither condemn me to the lower parts of the earth. For thou art the God, even the God of them that repent;

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:13
verses.text: and in me thou wilt shew all thy goodness: for thou wilt save me, that am unworthy, according to thy great mercy.

verses.name: Prayer of Manasseh 1:14
verses.text: Therefore I will praise thee for ever all the days of my life: for all the powers of the heavens do praise thee, and thine is the glory for ever and ever. Amen.
